title: Are NCERT books enough for the theory part for the JEE Mains? - Quora
tags: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)

response.answer_text: For Chem, they are. But for Phy and Maths you need some more books to make your concept clear, as NCERT Phy is so deep and one can’t get the complete taste in on JEE theory just by NCERT (the depth of NCERT will push you to refer more sources to understand the NCERT book). Maths, as much as I know they are basically for Board level. Exampler are good but for JEE you will still need more.
Well thoery of ncert is not enough because every topic is mentioned but it is not explained properly or in depth and for jee mains you need in depth knowledge of concepts
Only for chemistry it is enough for math you should go through Rd sharma objective and for physics HC verma which makes your concept crystal clear.
